revised_title: On the Finite Extent of the Atmosphere and the Existence of Ultimate Atoms
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, investigates the extent of the Earth's atmosphere and the existence of ultimate atoms. He examines the atmosphere of the Moon, the Sun, and Jupiter, concluding that the phenomenon of the Earth's atmosphere can only be maintained on the supposition of ultimate atoms of definite magnitude, no longer divisible by repulsion of their parts.
